intro: Leoheo domatiophorus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple blossoms that bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is a popular houseplant worldwide.
